intro: Stylisma heterophyla, commonly known as the variable stylisma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with two-lipped petals, typically in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or forest margins. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
